div.p: ROANOAK an Hand of North America, near the coaſt of North Carolina. Here the Engliſh firſt attempted to ſettle in 1585, but were obliged to leave it for want of proviſions. E. Long. 75. o. N. Lat. 35∙ 40.

p.hi: Roanoak, a river of North America, which riſes in Virginia, runs through Carolina, and at length falls into the ſea, where it forms a long narrow bay called
